intro: Desmopsis mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican desmopsis, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic alkaloids, which can be harmful to animals and humans. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
